articles.author: Phil Stewart
articles.description: The near-term risk of a broader war in the Middle East has eased somewhat after Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah exchanged fire without further escalation but Iran still poses a significant danger as it weighs a strike on Israel, America's top general said on Monday.
articles.title: Exclusive: Top US general says risk of broader war eases a bit after Israel-Hezbollah exchange

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched several waves of missile and drone attacks overnight targeting Kyiv and other regions, Ukraine's military said early on Tuesday, a day after Moscow's biggest such attack of the war.
articles.title: Russia pounds Ukraine with missiles, drones for second day in row, Kyiv says

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden's national security adviser Jake Sullivan is embarking on several days of talks with top Chinese officials in Beijing this week aimed at quieting tensions between the two superpowers ahead of the Nov. 5 U.S. election.
articles.title: Top US, China officials to meet on military, Taiwan, fentanyl

articles.author: Jihoon Lee, Cynthia Kim, Joyce Lee
articles.description: As South Korea scrambles to halt the sharp decline in its birth rate, policymakers are having a hard time convincing many in their 20s and 30s that parenthood is a better investment than stylish clothes or fancy restaurants.
articles.title: Korea's birth rate drive struggles to sway 'YOLO' generation

articles.author: Yimou Lee
articles.description: China spent about $15 billion, or 7% of its defence budget, on exercises in the Western Pacific in 2023, according to a previously unpublished Taiwanese estimate, showing Beijing's investment in military activity around Taiwan and its neighbours.
articles.title: Exclusive: China spent $15.3 billion on Pacific exercises in 2023

articles.author: Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: China called U.S. sanctions on its entities over the Ukraine war "illegal and unilateral" and "not based on facts", in comments on Tuesday ahead of White House National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan's arrival in Beijing for days of high-level talks.
articles.title: China calls US sanctions over Ukraine war 'illegal and unilateral'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Washington is behind the arrest of Telegram's CEO and founder Pavel Durov in France, the speaker of Russia's Duma, the lower house of parliament, Vyacheslav Volodin, said on Monday on the Telegram messaging app.
articles.title: Russia lawmaker, without providing evidence says US behind arrest of Telegram CEO

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ramadan Abed
articles.description: Israel issued new evacuation orders for Deir Al-Balah in the central Gaza Strip late on Sunday, forcing more families to flee, saying forces intended to act against militant group Hamas and others operating in the area.
articles.title: Families flee after new Israeli evacuation orders in Gaza as ceasefire hopes dim

articles.author: Renju Jose
articles.description: Australia said on Tuesday it would limit the enrolment number of international students at 270,000 for 2025, as the government looks to rein in record migration that has contributed to a spike in home rental prices.
articles.title: Australia to limit foreign student enrolments in migration crackdown

articles.author: Idrees Ali, Kanishka Singh
articles.description: U.S. Army Private Travis King, who last year ran into North Korea and was taken into custody there, will plead guilty to five charges, including desertion, while taking responsibility for his conduct, his lawyer said in a statement on Monday.
articles.title: US Army Private King who fled to North Korea to plead guilty to 5 charges
